Text.Value: ...The voice. Oh, gods, the voice. What happened?!

EditorData.NodeContext: Reality comes crashing in, horror as he realises he was under some terrible voice's control

Text.Value: Gods, I... I think you're right. It called out from the wreckage. Sounded just like my daughter.

EditorData.NodeContext: Mute shock as memories of being under the control of an alien creature come back to him

Text.Value: Start by handing over your valuables.
Your boat - can it be repaired?
I was defending myself. I'm sorry.
It was... calling for help. Gods above, it sounded just like my daughter.

EditorData.NodeContext: Mute horror as he realises that the monster was twisting his memories

Text.Value: This voice - what was it saying?
You - you what?
Gods, we just... we didn't know what we were doing. We heard a voice in the wreckage - my daughter's voice.

EditorData.NodeContext: Helpless fear and grief - he and his friends attacked the player while under the control of an alien creature, and now his friends are dead

Text.Value: But... she's been dead for years. That thing got into our heads - drove us mad.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grief, shock as he realises how the monster twisted his memories

Text.Value: I'm sorry, I... I saw the crash. Heard someone screaming in the wreckage - my daughter.

EditorData.NodeContext: Helpless fear and and confusion - he thought he was protecting his daughter from us, but it was just an alien creature using him

Text.Value: First things first. Where are we?
We didn't... we didn't mean to. We saw the wreckage and I thought... I thought I heard my daughter's voice.

EditorData.NodeContext: Helpless fear and grief - he and his friends attacked the player while under the control of an alien creature, and now his friends are dead

Text.Value: We wrecked our boat just trying to get close to it. What do we do now?

EditorData.NodeContext: Panic quietly building again as he realises he's stuck in dangerous wilderness

Text.Value: The same thing that happens to anyone who attacks me.
You tried to kill me, that's what.
What? I saved you from that thing.
There's something in your head! Please - I'll take my chances out here. Just... just don't hurt me any more!

EditorData.NodeContext: Frightened, fearful, not wanting to anger us but aiming to get away from us as quickly as possible

Text.Value: It could be worse - your ship didn't fall out of the sky.
That monster was using you like a puppet.
Wait. You... I can feel you. Just like one of those things. You're one of them!

EditorData.NodeContext: Creeping horror, a pause, and then panic - he's picking up similar psychic energy from us as an aftershock of the alien's domination - and he's terrified

Text.Value: ...Oh gods, Sonna. What happened to my friend?!

EditorData.NodeContext: Reality comes crashing in - Catching site of his dead friends and reacting with horror and fear

Text.Value: Whatever was happening, it ended with that monster.
We wrecked our boat just trying to get close to it. What do I do now?

EditorData.NodeContext: Panic quietly building again as he realises he's stuck in dangerous wilderness

Text.Value: You were protecting that creature.
Please - get away! We're building a raft - we'll bloody swim if need be. Just leave us be.

EditorData.NodeContext: Pleading, afraid, not wanting to provoke us but terrified we'll hurt him

Text.Value: You were on that thing? To survive that, only to land in this bloody wilderness.

EditorData.NodeContext: Wonder and shock that we were on a ship that fell from the sky and survived

Text.Value: The creature's dead - calm yourself.
It weren't our fault! We heard something calling out from the wreckage. It... it sounded like my daughter.
We're nowhere - that's the point. Even with a boat, Baldur's Gate is days -

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to hammer home how vulnerable you are in this wilderness, cutting off abruptly

Text.Value: ...Oh gods, Thale. What happened to my friend?!

EditorData.NodeContext: Reality comes crashing in - Catching site of his dead friends and reacting with horror and fear

Text.Value: ...Where... where are we? There was... fire in the sky, and then...

EditorData.NodeContext: Disoriented and slightly afraid, as if waking up from a bad dream and slowly realising it's real. He's just coming to from being under the control of a mindflayer

Text.Value: Not a chance - it's bloody driftwood. And we are in the middle of nowhere, even -

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to hammer home how vulnerable you are in this wilderness, cutting off abruptly

Text.Value: It looked like you were helping that thing.
Just... just let us go.

EditorData.NodeContext: Exhausted and pleading - they've been through enough

Text.Value: You allowed yourself to be dominated by a ghaik. To be contaminated.
Figure it out yourself. I have neither time nor patience to train a new slave.
Calm yourself - all is well now.
Show some gratitude, or you'll find that I'm a lot worse.
...Oh gods, my friends. What happened?!

EditorData.NodeContext: Reality comes crashing in - Catching site of his dead friends and reacting with horror and fear

Text.Value: We're in the middle of nowhere. The gods must have it out -

EditorData.NodeContext: shake of the head - despair

Text.Value: What are you - help!
There's something in your head! Please - we'll take our chances out here. Just... just leave us be!

EditorData.NodeContext: Frightened, fearful, not wanting to anger us but aiming to get away from us as quickly as possible

Text.Value: Calm down. They abducted me, but I escaped.
I'm sorry, it just... it sounded just like my daughter. I thought I was protecting her.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to calm himself at the player's request, but still in mute shock and horror as to how completely the creature was dominating him
